item.subtitle: The item(s) from the stimuli file
item.text: Specify here which row(s) you want to refer to in the stimuli sheet. If you want to refer to just one row, just write the row number. If you want to refer to multiple rows, write to, e.g. '2 to 5'. You should also be able to use commas, e.g. '2,3,5'.

description.subtitle: deprecated
description.text: please change this column header to name.

trial type.subtitle: Which trialtype do you want?
trial type.text: Specify one of the trialtypes out of the trialtypes listed below.

max time.subtitle: In milliseconds
max time.text: User will leave the trial going as long as it takes the participant to complete it. You can specify a time limit in milliseconds though. Be careful when specifying this. This will start from when the trial is presented to the participant. Unless you are presenting a very simple trial, you may want to use a Trial.start_timer() within the trialtype code in the experiment.

text.subtitle: Mainly for instruct trialtypes
text.text: You can refer to this in any trialtype with {{text}}, but typically this is what you would want presented in an instruct trialtype.

shuffle 1.subtitle: randomise trial order
shuffle 1.text: If you would like some trials shuffled together, write the same word next to the trials you want randomised together. For example, if I wanted the practice trials shuffled together, then I would write the word 'practice' in this column next to each of the practice trials
